Title: Getting an OmniStudio Enable SF Demo Org
Description: Absent any other means of getting an OmniStudio enabled Salesforce developer or demo org, go to: https://trailhead.salesforce.com/promo/orgs/omnistudiotrails and sign up for one

Title: Getting a Salesforce Consumer Key and Secret
Description: If you’re building an application that connects to Salesforce, one easy way to do that is to have a consumer key and secret for your API user. Here's how to get one

Title: Creating a Salesforce Named Credential
Description: You can embed your OpenAI API key directly into your demos, although that’s a very bad idea. A good idea is to create a Salesforce named credential to securely hold your API key.

Title: Getting Started with OpenAI
Description: Most of the demonstrations in this substack use OpenAI as the backend LLM system. To use it, you’ll need to sign up for an account with them to get an API key.

Title: Using Google Colab
Description: Google Colab is one of those strange free things on the web that make you think “this won’t last”. It’s an environment that allows you to run Python code for free on Google’s servers without installing anything locally.
